segment.source: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder
segment.target: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder

segment.source: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder
segment.target: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder

segment.source: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder
segment.target: Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder

segment.source: Why is the WinSxS folder so big?
segment.target: Why is the WinSxS folder so big?

segment.source: The short answer to this commonly asked question is that the component store (WinSxS folder) contains all the components that make-up Windows to allow you operate your system.
segment.target: The short answer to this commonly asked question is that the component store (WinSxS folder) contains all the components that make-up Windows to allow you operate your system.

segment.source: These components are kept to rollback any problematic change or to repair a file that becomes corrupted.
segment.target: These components are kept to rollback any problematic change or to repair a file that becomes corrupted.

segment.source: For more information about the component store, see Manage the Component Store.
segment.target: For more information about the component store, see Manage the Component Store.

segment.source: For information on how to delete files in the WinSxS folder, see Clean Up the WinSxS Folder.
segment.target: For information on how to delete files in the WinSxS folder, see Clean Up the WinSxS Folder.

segment.source: For operating system files, it can appear that more than one copy of the same version of a file is stored in more than one place on the operating system, but there’s usually only one real copy of the file.
segment.target: For operating system files, it can appear that more than one copy of the same version of a file is stored in more than one place on the operating system, but there’s usually only one real copy of the file.

segment.source: The rest of the copies are just “projected” by hard linking from the component store.
segment.target: The rest of the copies are just “projected” by hard linking from the component store.

segment.source: A hard link is a file system object that lets two files refer to the same location on disk.
segment.target: A hard link is a file system object that lets two files refer to the same location on disk.

segment.source: Some tools, such as the File Explorer, determine the size of directories without taking into account that the contained files might be hard linked.
segment.target: Some tools, such as the File Explorer, determine the size of directories without taking into account that the contained files might be hard linked.

segment.source: This might lead you to think that the WinSxS folder takes up more disk space than it really does.
segment.target: This might lead you to think that the WinSxS folder takes up more disk space than it really does.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Some important system files are located only in the WinSxS folder.
segment.target: Some important system files are located only in the WinSxS folder.

segment.source: Deleting files from the WinSxS folder or deleting the entire WinSxS folder might severely damage your system, so that your PC might not boot, and make it impossible to update.
segment.target: Deleting files from the WinSxS folder or deleting the entire WinSxS folder might severely damage your system, so that your PC might not boot, and make it impossible to update.

segment.source: A new option has been added to the DISM tool for Windows 8.1 to help determine how much disk space the WinSxS folder really uses.
segment.target: A new option has been added to the DISM tool for Windows 8.1 to help determine how much disk space the WinSxS folder really uses.

segment.source: Analyze the size of the component store (WinSxS folder)
segment.target: Analyze the size of the component store (WinSxS folder)

segment.source: Open an elevated command window and type:
segment.target: Open an elevated command window and type:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The /AnalyzeComponentStore option isn’t recognized on Windows 8 and earlier.
segment.target: The /AnalyzeComponentStore option isn’t recognized on Windows 8 and earlier.

segment.source: The information returned is:
segment.target: The information returned is:

segment.source: Title
segment.target: Title

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Windows Explorer Reported Size of Component Store
segment.target: Windows Explorer Reported Size of Component Store

segment.source: This value the size of the WinSxS folder if computed by Windows Explorer.
segment.target: This value the size of the WinSxS folder if computed by Windows Explorer.

segment.source: This value doesn’t factor in the use of hard links within the WinSxS folder.
segment.target: This value doesn’t factor in the use of hard links within the WinSxS folder.

segment.source: Actual Size of Component Store
segment.target: Actual Size of Component Store

segment.source: This value factors in hard links within the WinSxS folder.
segment.target: This value factors in hard links within the WinSxS folder.

segment.source: It doesn’t exclude files that are shared with Windows by using hard links.
segment.target: It doesn’t exclude files that are shared with Windows by using hard links.

segment.source: Shared with Windows
segment.target: Shared with Windows

segment.source: This value provides the size of files that are hard linked so that they appear both in the component store and in other locations (for the normal operation of Windows).
segment.target: This value provides the size of files that are hard linked so that they appear both in the component store and in other locations (for the normal operation of Windows).

segment.source: This is included in the actual size, but shouldn’t be considered part of the component store overhead.
segment.target: This is included in the actual size, but shouldn’t be considered part of the component store overhead.

segment.source: Backups and Disabled Features
segment.target: Backups and Disabled Features

segment.source: This is the size of the components that are being kept to respond to failures in newer components or to provide the option of enabling more functionality.
segment.target: This is the size of the components that are being kept to respond to failures in newer components or to provide the option of enabling more functionality.

segment.source: It also includes the size of component store metadata and side-by-side components.
segment.target: It also includes the size of component store metadata and side-by-side components.

segment.source: This is included in the actual size and is part of the component store overhead.
segment.target: This is included in the actual size and is part of the component store overhead.

segment.source: Cache and Temporary Data
segment.target: Cache and Temporary Data

segment.source: This is the size of files that are used internally by the component store to make component servicing operations faster.
segment.target: This is the size of files that are used internally by the component store to make component servicing operations faster.

segment.source: This is included in the actual size and is part of the component store overhead.
segment.target: This is included in the actual size and is part of the component store overhead.

segment.source: Date of Last Cleanup
segment.target: Date of Last Cleanup

segment.source: This is the date of the most recently completed component store cleanup.
segment.target: This is the date of the most recently completed component store cleanup.

segment.source: Number of Reclaimable Packages
segment.target: Number of Reclaimable Packages

segment.source: This is the number of superseded packages on the system that component cleanup can remove.
segment.target: This is the number of superseded packages on the system that component cleanup can remove.

segment.source: Component Store Cleanup Recommended
segment.target: Component Store Cleanup Recommended

segment.source: This is a component store cleanup recommendation.
segment.target: This is a component store cleanup recommendation.

segment.source: Cleanup is recommended when performing a cleanup process may reduce the size of the component store overhead.
segment.target: Cleanup is recommended when performing a cleanup process may reduce the size of the component store overhead.

segment.source: Based on this analysis you can determine the overhead of the WinSxS folder by taking the sum of the backups and disabled features size with the cache and temporary data size.
segment.target: Based on this analysis you can determine the overhead of the WinSxS folder by taking the sum of the backups and disabled features size with the cache and temporary data size.

segment.source: Example output:
segment.target: Example output:

segment.source: In this example, the WinSxS folder appears to be 4.98 GB, but the actual overhead (the sum of the size of backups and disabled features and the size of cache and temporary data) is 786.42 MB.
segment.target: In this example, the WinSxS folder appears to be 4.98 GB, but the actual overhead (the sum of the size of backups and disabled features and the size of cache and temporary data) is 786.42 MB.

segment.source: Determine if you should clean up the component store (WinSxS folder) based on the analysis results
segment.target: Determine if you should clean up the component store (WinSxS folder) based on the analysis results

segment.source: Open an elevated command window and type:
segment.target: Open an elevated command window and type:

segment.source: If cleanup is recommended then follow steps in the related topic, Clean Up the WinSxS Folder.
segment.target: If cleanup is recommended then follow steps in the related topic, Clean Up the WinSxS Folder.
